intro: Turbinicarpus × amabilis, commonly known as the hybrid moon cactus, is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Turbinicarpus calycinus and Turbinicarpus leucophaeus. It is characterized by its fleshy, segmented stems that store water, typical of cacti adapted to arid environments. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its succulent leaves are usually covered in a white, waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Due to its unique appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
